titleStmt.title: Herman Hadlan v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Herman Hadlan v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Olympia
In the matter of the application of Herman Hadlan for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the and for John P Hoyt of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory

The Petitions of Herman Hadlan respectfully shows - That he the said Herman Hadlan is unlawfully imprisoned detained, confined, and restrianed of his liberty by D.M. Brown. City Marshall of the City of Olympia in the City jail of Olympia Thurston County Washington Territory.
That said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal, and the illegality thereof consists in this towit

That on the 2nd day of July AD 1884 he was by process issued out of the Justice Court of W.T. Keady Esq Olympia Precinct Thurston County Washington Territory sitting as committing magistrate for the City of Olympia arrested and taken before that tribunal charged with the offense of violating the of Ordinance Number 191 of the City of Olympia by selling liquor without a license, (which said ordinance is entitled "All Ordinances to amend all Ordinances of the City of Olympia W.T. Known as Ordinance Number 149 an Ordinance lisences, regulating the manner of issuing the same and fixing the times and rates thereof approved February 22nd 1882.) under a sworn complaint so charging him filed in said Court. That he was arrained plead not guilty and was by the said Committing Magistrate adjudged guilty and ordered and adjudged to pay a fee of Forty Dollars and costs, and committed to the City jail in default of such fine and costs, under a committment in needs as follows towit. issued out of said Committing Magistrate Court and devoted to said Marshall.

That said Ordinances under which your petitioner was so commited and is now imprisoned are whereby void and without effect and that the City of Olympia has no power to pass the same under its charter.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that as a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to the said D.M. Brown Marshall as aforesaid, com- manding him to have the body of said Herman Hadlan before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning said Herman Hadlan together with the time and cause of his detention and said writ and that he the said Herman Hadlan may be restored to his liberty.
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss

Herman Hadlan being forth duly sworn depose and says I am the Petitioner named in and who signed the foregoing petitions. I have heard the same read know the contents thereof and believe the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 2nd day of July AD 1884
G.C. Israel Notary Public for Washington Territory
